sen.j: 狩野元信（かのう もとのぶ、 文明 (日本)8年8月9日 (旧暦)（1476年8月28日）? - 永禄2年10月6日 (旧暦)（1559年11月5日））は、室町時代の絵師で、狩野派の祖・狩野正信の子である。
sen.e: Motonobu KANO (August 28, 1476 - November 5, 1559) was a painter of the Muromachi period, and the son of Kano school's founder, Masanobu KANO.
Motonobu KANO (August 28, 1476 - November 5, 1559) was a painter of the Muromachi period, and the son of the Kano school's founder, Masanobu KANO.
Motonobu KANO (September 6, 1476 - November 15, 1559) was a painter of the Muromachi period, and the son of the Kano school's founder, Masanobu KANO.
sen.cmt: August 28→September 6に変更しました。November 5→November 15に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都の生まれ。
sen.e: Born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.

sen.j: 父・正信の画風を継承するとともに、大和絵の技法を取り入れ、狩野派の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: He inherited his father's style, but also introduced the Yamato-e technique and created the base for the Kano school.
He inherited his father's style, but also introduced the Yamato-e technique, forming the basis of the Kano school.
sen.cmt: and created the base for'→', forming the basis of'
sen.e: He inherited his father's style, but also introduced the technique of Yamato-e painting (a traditional Japanese style painting of the late Heian and Kamakura periods dealing with Japanese themes), forming the basis of the Kano school.
sen.cmt: the Yamato-e technique→the technique of Yamato-e paintingとし、補足を追加

sen.j: 狩野元信は、狩野派の初代・正信の子（長男または次男とされる）で、狩野派2代目である。
sen.e: Motonobu KANO was either the first or the second son of the Kano school's founder, Masanobu KANO and the second head of the Kano school.
Motonobu KANO was the son of Kano school's founder, Masanobu KANO (Said to be either the first or the second son), and the second generation of Kano school.
sen.cmt: Changed word orderDeleted 'was said to be'Added 'the''generation'→'head'
sen.e: Motonobu KANO was either the first or the second son of the Kano school's founder, Masanobu KANO and the second head of the Kano school.
sen.cmt: chekerのコメントおよび訳文より、この文だけtrans1とtrans2が入れ替わっているように思われます。Trans1の訳文をいれました。

sen.j: 元信は、近世へと続く狩野派の画風の大成者であり、近世における狩野派繁栄の基礎を築いた画家である。
sen.e: Motonobu perfected the painting style of the Kano school which continued into recent times, and was the painter who created the foundation for the glory of the Kano school in recent times.
Motonobu perfected the painting style of the Kano school and laid the foundations for the success of the Kano school, which continued until the modern era.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence- don't think there's a need to repeat recent times even though it's in the original.
sen.e: Motonobu perfected the painting style of the Kano school and laid the foundations for the success of the Kano school, which continued until the modern era.

sen.j: 後世「古法眼」（こほうげん）と通称された。
sen.e: In later age, he was called "Kohogen".
In later life he was called "Kohogen".
In later life he was called 'Kohogen.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 絵師としての記録上の初見は永正10年（1513年）で、この時、『鞍馬寺縁起絵』を制作している。
sen.e: His first appearance as a painter on the historical record was 1513, when he produced "Kurama-Engi-e".
His first appearance as a painter in the historical record was in 1513, when he produced "Kuramadera-Engi-e".
sen.cmt: on'→'in'Added 'in'Original has '鞍馬寺',though not sure if it's 'dera' or 'ji'
sen.e: His first appearance as a painter in the historical record was in 1513, when he produced "Kuramadera-Engi-e"(painting of the history of Kurama-dera Temple).

sen.j: 現存する大徳寺大仙院の障壁画は、同院創建時の永正10年（1513）の制作とするのが通説であったが、大仙院方丈の改築が行われた天文 (元号)4年（1535年）の作とする見方もある。
sen.e: The partition wall painting of Daitoku-ji Temple Daisen-in, which still exists, is normally said to be produced on 1513 at the time of the building of Daisen-in, however, there is some speculation which suggests it was built in 1535, which was the time of the renovation of Daisen-in Hojo.

The partition wall painting of Daisen-in in Daitoku-ji Temple, which still exists, is usually said to have been produced in 1513, at the time of the building of Daisen-in but there is some speculation that it was painted in 1535, when Daisen-in Hojo was renovated.

The partition wall painting of Daisen-in in Daitoku-ji Temple, which still exists, is usually said to have been produced in 1513, at the time of the building of Daisen-in but there is some speculation that it was painted in 1535, when Daisen-in Hojo (an abbot's chamber) was renovated.

sen.j: 元信は60歳代にあたる天文年間に以下のような大きな仕事に携わっている。
sen.e: Motonobu was involved in the following major projects during his sixties.
Motonobu was involved in the following major projects during his sixties.
Motonobu was involved in the following major projects during his sixties.

sen.j: まず、天文8年（1539）から約15年間、石山本願寺の障壁画制作に携わった。
sen.e: First, approximately 15 years from 1539, he was involved in the partition wall painting of Ishiyama-Hongan-ji Temple.
First, for approximately 15 years from 1539, he was involved in the partition wall painting of Ishiyama-Hongan-ji Temple.
First, for approximately 15 years from 1539, he was involved in the partition wall painting of Ishiyama-Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: この間、天文12年（1543）には内裏小御所、同じ頃には妙心寺霊雲院の障壁画を描き、天文14年（1545）頃に法眼（僧の位の一つ）を与えられている。
sen.e: During this time, he also painted at Dairi-kogosho in 1543, and at the same time, painted the partition wall paint of Myoshin-ji Temple Reiun-in, when he was awarded Hogen (one of ranks of Monk).

During this period, in 1543, he painted at Dairi-kogosho (the imperial palace) and, around the same time, painted the partition wall of Reiun-in in Myoshin-ji Temple, and in 1545 was awarded the rank of Hogen.

During this period, in 1543, he painted at Dairi-kogosho (the imperial palace) and, around the same time, painted the partition wall of Reiun-in in Myoshin-ji Temple, and in 1545 was awarded the rank of Hogen (the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: 「法眼」→統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 元信は、室町幕府、朝廷、石山本願寺など、時の有力者より庇護を受けつつ、戦国時代 (日本)の乱世を生き抜いた絵師であった。
sen.e: Motonobu was a painter protected by the magnates such as Muromachi Shogunate, the Court and Ishiyama-Hongan-ji Temple, and survived the turmoil of the Japanese Sengoku period (Period of Japanese Warring States).
Due to the protection of such powerful patrons as the Muromachi Shogunate, the Imperial Court and Ishiyama-Hongan-ji Temple, he was able to survive the turmoil of the Warring States period.

Due to the protection of such powerful patrons as the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the Imperial Court and Ishiyama-Hongan-ji Temple, he was able to survive the turmoil of the Sengoku period (period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: Muromachi Shogunate→Muromachi bakufuとし、補足を追加、「戦国時代」→統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 元信の作品は、漢画（大和絵に対して中国風の画を指す）系の水墨画を基礎としつつ、大和絵系の土佐派の様式を取り入れ、書院造建築の装飾にふさわしい日本的な障壁画様式を確立した点に特色がある。
sen.e: Motonobu's works are notable for introducing the Tosa school style of Yamato-e whilst being based on the ink-wash painting method in the Kanga style (which indicates Chinese style paintings compared to Yamato-e, Japanese style paintings), and was created for the Japanese partition wall painting adequate for the decoration of Shoin-zukuri (Japanese architectual style) buildings.

Motonobu's works are notable for melding the Tosa school style of Yamato-e (colourful, Japanese style paintings) onto the ink-wash painting method of the Kanga style (typically monochrome, Chinese style paintings), and establishing a particularly Japanese style of partition wall painting, suitable for the decoration of buildings of the traditional Shoin-zukuri architectual style.
sen.cmt: Rewrote the sentence but took some liberties with the translation, especially splitting the phrase in brackets into 2 and adding 'colorful' and 'typically monochrome' to the explanation of the painting styles.
sen.e: Motonobu's works are notable for melding the Tosa school style of Yamato-e painting onto the ink-wash painting method of the Kanga style (typically monochrome, Chinese style paintings), and establishing a particularly Japanese style of partition wall painting, suitable for the decoration of buildings of the traditional Shoin-zukuri architectual style.
sen.cmt: 大和絵→Yamato-e paintingとし、既出のため補足を削除
